contentrichtext.text: '''Julius August Ludwig Wegscheider''' (27 September 1771 - 27 January 1849), was a [[Germany|German]] [[Protestant]] [[theology|theologian]]. He was born at Küblingen (now a part of [[Schöppenstedt]], [[Lower Saxony]]). He studied theology at the [[University of Helmstedt]], where he was a pupil of [[ Heinrich Philipp Konrad Henke]]. From 1795 to 1805, he worked as a tutor to the family of a wealthy [[Hamburg]] merchant. In 1805 he was repentant at the [[University of Göttingen]] with a dissertation titled ''Graecorum mysteriis religioni non obtrudendis'', he then served as a professor of theology at the University of [[Rinteln]] (1806–1810), and at the [[University of Halle]] from 1810 onwards.<ref>[http://de.wikisource.org/wiki/ADB:Wegscheider,_Julius_August_Ludwig Biography] @ [[Allgemeine Deutsche Biographie]]</ref> Wegscheider was a leading figure of dogmatic [[neology|theological rationalism]] — for instance, he considered [[supernatural revelation]] to be an impossibility.<ref>[http://cyclopedia.lcms.org/display.asp?t1=w&word=WEGSCHEIDER.JULIUSAUGUSTLUDWIG Christian Cyclopedia] J. A. L. Wegscheider (biographical information)</ref> Because of his rationalist teachings, he, along with his colleague [[Wilhelm Gesenius]], were attacked by followers of [[Supernaturalism]], creating a situation that led to a government investigation (1830).<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=sJpRAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA108&lpg=PA108&dq=%22Wegscheider,+Julius%22+1771&source=bl&ots=eYsR-fKwIJ&sig=Y_A0FpYG49aliY6E8EcxJ0SZnFQ&hl=mr&sa=X&ei=IH6VUfTaC6rIiwLY8oH4BA&ved=0CEQQ6AEwBjgU#v=onepage&q=%22Wegscheider%2C%20Julius%22%201771&f=false Encyclopædia Americana: a popular dictionary of arts, sciences ..., Volume 13] by Edward Wigglesworth, Thomas Gamaliel Bradford</ref> Ultimately, he retained his office at Halle, but lost his former influence. == Principal works == * ''Über die von der neuesten Philosophie geforderte Trennung der Moral von der Religion'', 1804 - On the latest philosophy requiring separation of morality from religion. * ''Versuch einer vollständigen Einleitung in das Evangelium Johannis'', 1806 - Attempt of a complete introduction to the [[Gospel of John]]. * ''Institutiones theologicae dogmaticae'', 1815; to which Wilhelm Steiger's ''Kritik des Rationalismus in Wegscheiders Dogmatik'' (1830) was a reply. * '''Books about Wegscheider''' ** "Leben und Werk des Hallenser Theologen Julius Wegscheider (1771-1849) : mit unveröffentlichten Briefen an Eduard Reuss"; by Jean Marcel Vincent, Waltrop : Spenner, 1997.
